abstract: G.E. said profit from continuing operations rose 29 percent, to $3.16 billion. And earnings per share increased 32 percent, to 29 cents a share, beating expectations.
snippet: G.E. said profit from continuing operations rose 29 percent, to $3.16 billion. And earnings per share increased 32 percent, to 29 cents a share, beating expectations.
lead_paragraph: General Electric has come a long way back since the financial crisis sent it reeling. The company has pared back its troubled finance arm, focused on its mainstay industrial business, cut costs and revived profits. But G.E.’s credibility on Wall Street remains shaky, with any sign of weakness punished by waves of selling.

headline.main: A Dip in Profit and Soft Industrial Sales at G.E. Send Its Shares Down
headline.print_headline: A Dip in Profit and Soft Industrial Sales at G.E. Send Its Shares Down
